poem:
### Synth Reverberations

The beats of synthesizers  
echo still in the lonely valleys,  
where once you dared to tread  
a landscape woven with electric dreams.  
Syllables from the past linger in the air;  
melodies born of wires and longing,  
haunting now in silence,  
as the hedgerow listens,  
remembering the vibrant  
dance of your fleeting breath.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stephen Luscombe obituary Stephen Luscombe, who has died aged 70 after suffering from an abdominal aortic aneurysm and heart problems, cemented his place in pop history with his work with his musical partner Neil Arthur in Blancmange. Stars of the synth-pop wave of the 1980s, alongside contemporaries such as Depeche Mode, Pet Shop Boys and Soft Cell, Blancmange made their first big impact with their UK Top 10 hit Living on the Ceiling (1982), while". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
